title: Job Openings at Work Dey HR Services
content:
Work Dey HR Services offers a wide range of HR Consulting Services to Organizations and Individuals. We match Suitable ans employable applicants to Genuine Vacancies in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Grill Chef

Job Location: Central Area, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing high-quality grilled dishes, maintaining kitchen safety and sanitation, and contributing to a positive kitchen environment.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and cook grilled meats, vegetables, and other menu items to perfection.
	Maintain grill stations, equipment, and utensils.
	Ensure food safety and sanitation protocols are followed.
	Collaborate with other kitchen staff to ensure seamless service.
	Develop new recipes and menu ideas.


Requirements


	Culinary training or experience in grilling.
	3+ years of experience as a Grill Chef or similar role.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to work under pressure.
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary (N80,000 - N100,000 monthly) and benefits.
	Opportunities for growth and development.
	Dynamic work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career.wsl@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Human Resources (HR) / Legal Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Provide HR services and functions within the company
	Provide legal guidance and support on contractual matters, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
	Draft, review, and negotiate a variety of contracts, including vendor agreements, client contracts, and subcontractor agreements.
	Conduct legal research to support decision-making and ensure the company's practices align with current legal standards.
	Develop and deliver legal training programs to enhance the legal awareness of internal teams.
	Advise on intellectual property matters and contribute to the protection of the company's legal interests.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess legal risks and provide strategic advice to mitigate potential issues.
	Stay informed about changes in legislation and legal precedents that may impact the contracting firm's operations.
	Assist in the resolution of legal disputes, including participating in negotiations and liaising with external legal counsel when necessary.
	Maintain and update legal documentation, contracts, and records systematically.
	Support the development and implementation of corporate policies and procedures to ensure legal compliance.


Qualifications


	A Degree in Law from a recognized institution.
	Admission to the bar and a valid license to practice law in the relevant jurisdiction.
	Proven experience in contract law and legal counsel roles, preferably within the contracting or construction industry.
	Strong knowledge of business and commercial law.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career.wsl@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Project Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Lead and manage projects from initiation to completion.
	Develop and implement project plans, ensuring goals and objectives are met.
	Effectively allocate resources, manage budgets, and track project timelines.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders for project success.
	Identify and mitigate risks to ensure smooth project delivery.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in project management, Quantity Surveying, Civil Engineering, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in the construction industry.
	Project management experience is compulsory.
	Experience in Road & Drainage construction is compulsory.


Skills:


	Strong leadership and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Proficiency in project management tools and software.
	Problem-solving and decision-making skills.


Salary
N150,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career.wsl@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at Longbridge Technologies Limited
content:
Longbridge Technologies Limited - At LONGBRIDGE, by offering competent management and a distinctive approach, we strive to position businesses for sustainable growth. This is driven by our core objective which is focused on creating and sustaining growth for individuals and enterprises through innovation.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Human Resources and Admin Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an experienced and motivated HR and Admin Manager to lead our people operations and administrative functions.
	This role is instrumental in shaping our company culture, managing our workforce, and ensuring the smooth execution of administrative processes.


Responsibilities


	People Operations Leadership: Develop and execute HR strategies, policies, and programs that align with the company's goals and foster a positive workplace culture.
	Talent Acquisition: Oversee the recruitment process, working closely with department managers to identify staffing needs, conducting interviews, and ensuring a seamless onboarding experience for new hires.
	Employee Relations: Address employee concerns, provide guidance on company policies, and promote a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
	Performance Management: Implement and manage performance appraisal processes, providing feedback and coaching to employees and managers to drive professional growth and development.
	Training and Development: Identify training needs, develop training programs, and facilitate learning opportunities to enhance employee skills and competencies.
	Compensation and Benefits: Administer compensation and benefits programs, ensuring competitive and fair compensation packages while staying current with industry trends.
	HR Compliance: Ensure compliance with labor laws and regulations, keeping abreast of legal requirements and making necessary adjustments to company policies and practices.
	Admin Operations: Oversee administrative functions such as office management, facilities, vendor relationships, and procurement to maintain an efficient and productive workplace.
	Records and Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records, contracts, and other relevant documentation, adhering to data privacy and confidentiality guidelines.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field; HR certification is a plus.
	Proven experience as an HR professional, with at least 5 years of experience in HR management roles.
	Strong understanding of HR best practices, labour laws, and regulations.
	Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with employees at all levels.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality, exercise good judgment, and handle sensitive matters with discretion.
	Effective leadership skills, capable of guiding and mentoring a team to achieve HR and admin goals.
	Proficiency in HRIS systems and Microsoft Office Suite.


Application Closing Date: 27th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume and a cover letter outlining their relevant experience and explaining why they are an ideal fit for this role to: HR@longbridgetech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Senior Backend / Full Stack Java Software Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Architect and lead the design of scalable, secure, and high-performing enterprise-grade applications.
	Develop and maintain robust back-end services and APIs using Java (Java 8+), Spring Boot, Hibernate, and other modern Java technologies.
	Design and optimize database models and queries in Oracle and MS SQL, ensuring high performance and data integrity.
	Collaborate with stakeholders to define system architecture, scalability, and security requirements.
	Integrate with front-end technologies such as React.js, Vue.js, or Angular where applicable.
	Implement and manage reporting functionalities using JasperReports or similar tools.
	Conduct code reviews and provide architectural guidance to the development team.
	Troubleshoot complex technical issues and ensure application reliability and performance.
	Mentor junior developers and contribute to engineering best practices and continuous improvement.
	Stay abreast of industry trends, tools, and technologies, and recommend innovations that drive product quality and business efficiency.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	7+ years of professional experience in Java-based software development.
	Proven experience in designing and developing enterprise applications.
	Familiarity with JasperReports or other enterprise reporting tools.
	Experience integrating with modern front-end frameworks (React, Vue, or Angular).
	Solid understanding of software architecture, data modeling, and software design patterns.
	Expert knowledge of Java 8+, Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring Cloud, Hibernate, and JPA.
	Strong experience with RESTful API design, microservices architecture, and service-oriented systems.
	Deep knowledge of MS SQL and Oracle, including stored procedures, performance tuning, and complex queries.
	Excellent analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication and leadership skills.


Nice to Have:


	Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
	DevOps knowledge including CI/CD pipelines, Jenkins, GitLab CI.
	Java certification(s) or architectural certifications (e.g., TOGAF, AWS Certified Architect).
	Experience with Agile/Scrum environments and tools like Jira or Azure DevOps.


Application Closing Date: 31st July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: HR@longbridgetech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you are an accomplished Java developer ready to architect and lead enterprise-level projects, we invite you to apply.

 

3.) Senior Front-End Software Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain complex, responsive, and scalable user interfaces using Vue.js and other modern frameworks like React.js or Angular.
	Architect reusable front-end components and ensure maintainable code structures.
	Collaborate with back-end developers and designers to translate business requirements into functional web applications.
	Optimize applications for performance, speed, and cross-browser/device compatibility.
	Integrate with RESTful APIs and ensure seamless interaction with server-side systems.
	Lead code reviews, maintain coding standards, and mentor junior front-end engineers.
	Contribute to DevOps, CI/CD, and automation of front-end workflows.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
	7+ years of professional front-end development experience.
	Expertise in Vue.js is mandatory, including experience with Vuex or Pinia and Vue Router.
	Strong proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3.
	Proven experience working with React.js, Angular, or other modern front-end frameworks.
	Deep understanding of front-end best practices, performance optimization, and responsive design.
	Experience with front-end tooling like Vite, Webpack, Babel, and testing tools such as Jest or Cypress.
	Familiarity with version control (Git) and Agile software development practices.
	Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


Nice to Have:


	Experience with UI libraries like Vuetify, Tailwind CSS, or Bootstrap.
	Familiarity with DevOps tools and CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI, Jenkins, etc.).
	Experience with accessibility (WCAG), internationalization (i18n), or mobile-first design.
	Exposure to Docker, RESTful service design, and Figma for design hand-offs.
	A portfolio or examples of front-end projects or contributions to open-source.


Application Closing Date: 25th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and any portfolio links to: HR@longbridgetech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: If you're a senior developer passionate about building intuitive and high-performance user interfaces using Vue.js and other modern tools, we encourage you to apply!

 

 

4.) Intermediate Mobile Application Developer (Android / iOS)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Design, build, and maintain user-friendly mobile applications for Android and/or iOS using Kotlin, Java, Swift, or Flutter
	Collaborate with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to implement features and refine app functionality
	Translate UI/UX wireframes into high-performance, responsive mobile applications
	Optimize applications for maximum speed, performance, and usability
	Diagnose and resolve application bugs and performance bottlenecks
	Integrate applications with RESTful APIs and third-party SDKs
	Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code
	Conduct unit testing and participate in end-to-end testing before deployment
	Keep up with emerging mobile trends and technologies to improve development workflow
	Maintain existing mobile apps with regular fixes, updates, and feature enhancements
	Participate in code reviews and share feedback with team members
	Contribute to improving mobile development standards and best practices


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline
	2–4 years of hands-on experience building Android and/or iOS applications
	Proficiency in Kotlin, Java (Android) or Swift (iOS); experience with Flutter or React Native is a strong advantage
	Demonstrated experience in publishing applications to Google Play Store or Apple App Store
	Solid understanding of mobile architecture, application lifecycle, and state management
	Comfortable working with RESTful APIs, JSON, and common mobile libraries
	Experience with Git or other version control systems
	Familiarity with Agile methodologies and sprint-based development
	Strong debugging, problem-solving, and analytical skills
	Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team
	Understanding of mobile app security best practices and performance tuning
	Experience with mobile-focused cloud services (e.g. Firebase, AWS Amplify, Azure App Center)
	Portfolio of live apps or contributions to open-source mobile projects
	Capacity to deliver in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment
	Experience with Flutter, React Native, or Xamarin for cross-platform development
	Exposure to mobile DevOps tools such as Fastlane, CodeMagic, GitHub Actions, or Bitrise
	Familiarity with mobile store review guidelines and release management.


Application Closing Date: 20th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a short Cover Letter to: HR@longbridgetech.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Electrical / Electronics Engineer Job at Sales Force Consulting
content:
Sales Force Consulting - Our client is a major manufacturing company that majors in diverse polyethylene and cellophane packaging materials with two factories located in Asaba.

As part of their expansion program, they are recruiting experienced candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical / Electronics Engineer

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Candidate must possess basic experience in the design installation, assembly and repairs of diverse electrical machines
	Design electronic systemsand components for industrial and commercial applications.
	Create testing procedures and maintenance for electronic equipment and components.
	Recommend design modifications and equipment repair.
	Inspect electronic systems, instruments and equipment to ensure they meet applicable regulations and safety standards.


Requirements


	HND in Electrical / Electronic Engineering.
	Possess a minimum of 8 years of practical experience preferably from plastics products related or a manufacturingcompany
	Candidate must be an experienced Electrical / ElectronicsEngineer
	Must be less than 45years of age
	HND graduates only.


Other Conditions:


	They must be very hardworking, target oriented, with high level of integrity
	There is accommodation so the ideal candidateshould be ready to reside in Asaba.
	He must preferably have worked or is currently working in a manufacturing company with organized systems and procedures
	They must be ready to be interviewed and resume immediately.


Skill Set:


	Ability to work independently with little supervision.
	Attention to details
	Leadership skills.


Interview Mode:


	Physical (In the Asaba factory).


Benefits


	Salary: N300,000 - N400,000 / Month.
	There is accommodation.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV (PDF or Word) to: salesforceconsultingng@gmail.com using “Electrical / Electronics Engineer - Asaba" as the subject of the email.

Note


	Enquiries: Text or Whatsapp 08120796570 (No calls pls)
	Only candidates who meet set criteria shall be shortlisted for invitation.
